meta.title: Tears of Enceladus Demo
meta.author: Milan Kazarka
meta.info: Tears of Enceladus - Visual novel by Milan Kazarka

page.text: 'What strange phenomena we find in a great city, all we need do is stroll about with our eyes open. Life swarms with innocent monsters.' - Charles Baudelaire
Is this still a dream?
I feel reality slowly oozing into my consciousness.
But my dream isn't yet gone.
I remember believing everything I dreamt to be true, but now I'm not so sure.
Suddenly, I feel a tremendous heat coursing through my body.
It's awakening all of my senses.
My drowsiness fades away.
Now my dream just feels like a distortion of reality.
Will I be disappointed by this real world?
What is this?
A disturbence unknown to me.
One of my special few has awakened prematurely.
She's astray now. With her intelligence and thinking she's an alien to any environment or being on Enceladus.
All unknowns must be taken care off. This is one that is too large.
Don't worry little one, I'll wake up your brother and he will guide you back home.
This is a strange sensation.
How can this be the beginning of time.
I know what it means to hear... and I do hear something.
There is a voice piercing through the calm space I'm looking at.
I just woke up and...
The voice is telling me what to do... how I should continue living... it's giving me a purpose.
Find her.
Find her and bring her back.
Is this the one I'm after?
It must be her.
Why is she just staring at me?
Just looking, not attacking, not moving even a little bit.
Do I look the same?
Am I of the same kind?
I look down at my hand, at my body, and I do look different.
Why am I different from you?
Her thoughts pierce my head!
It's a strange sensation.
Her thoughts—I can feel them echoing inside myself.
As if my head were an echo chamber itself.
I am not angry, nor am I afraid.
More than anything, I am curious.
That I am too.
Good. Now finish what I am asking of you.
Finish your mission.
My mission.
My purpose.
What is your purpose?
My purpose is to bring you back.
Back where?
I just woke up.
Why should I go back?
Should I go back to sleep?
I waited for so long to be awake, to be at last in the real world.
(What does she mean by waiting?)
I have no recollection of anything before encountering Father.
There are no memories, thoughts, nothing.
That... can't be.
You haven't dreamt before you woke up?
Do you have any memories prior to waking up from your pod?
There is nothing.
No time.
Not even darkness.
You are an infant!
Nothing but instincts!
How terrible.
How do you even make decisions?
I have a mission.
Given to you by Father, right?
You are supposed to bring me back.
Do you know anything else than that?
There is no need to know more than what is your purpose.
Suddenly, I feel a sharp pain in my head.
The urge to obey Father is making my hands shake.
An invisible force is pushing me towards this being that is at the same time similar to me, but not at all like me.
Have you noticed?
Other beings. Humans, maybe?
There is a flickering, a movement, shadows on the walls.
Now that I think of it...
There were beings there when I woke up.
There are beings here too. In the distance, small. Some stand still, some move.

choice.message: What are those figures, those living beings?
I don't care about those other beings.

page.text: I dreamt of people.
Of different humans.
Of beings similar to us, to a point where I could talk to them too.
I interacted with them, laughed, cried.
But I can no longer recognize people's faces in this real world.
I know they are there.
I see them move, or rather run away as they see me.
But I can't distinguish one from another. I do not understand their language.
It's all just barking to me.
Are they not human? Those living figures.
Where have all the people gone?
Why is everyone just a faceless creature?
They are not us.
Why are they here?
What purpose do they serve?
I do not know.
Do I even need more of this confusion?
Do not worry about humans.
Do not worry about anything.
Your life has one purpose, and that is to stop chaos.
She is now the bringer of chaos.
It does not matter if she does it willingly or unwillingly.
Make her come back on her own or bring her back.
That is all that matters.
Do you not care about your surroundings?
Do you not care about the world you were born into?
Do you even distinguish between your feelings, thoughts, and the outside world?
Do you even understand that they are separate?!
I remember dreaming of feeling cold. I remember being frightened and hating feeling cold.
But now all I feel is burning. I sense a tremendous heat coming from within me.
(True. We are barely protected with our clothes.)
I feel like the center of the world too.
There's a vibrating energy emanating from me.
Is that it? Is that the heat?
If you focus, you will notice the other living figures wearing thick protective suits.
(I saw figures around me as I woke up wearing heavy suits. I also saw other figures walking down the halls of the city wearing thick layers of clothes.)

choice.message: What are those figures, those living beings?

page.text: Do you not remember what cold means?
I guess you don't. You do not have memories at all.
No. You are wrong. I do have feelings.
Those feelings lack thoughts and memories. There is only Father now.
But how can that be? How can there be feelings emerging from nothing?
I need to focus. Come back. I'm sure everything will be all right when you come back.
Why should I listen to a confused little infant?
(What is this feeling? Is it anger? I am angry about those words. I need to think about my mission.)
Just come back with me. Please. Sorry, but are you even listening to me?
Why did you run away? Why don't you want to come back?
Curiosity. I guess... You don't understand, since you didn't spend ages waiting. I waited for so long to wake up. To experience the Universe I only dreamt of.
I know I should be frightened of the outside. There is an endless dark void out there, but instead of wanting to avoid it, I am drawn to it.
It's as if a new instinct in me were born, and it's telling me that I'll feel at home out there outside of the protective walls. The void outside is not empty.
A dark void outside. Am I not supposed to take you back for you to be put back to sleep? Isn't that a dark void too?
No! It's not. Dreams aren't real and besides - will I even dream again?
I do not know.
How do you know?
You don't even know what dreams are.
(I have no time. The mission...)

choice.message: Grab her. Bring her back by force.

page.text: Come with me.
I need to get you home, and I don't want to use force.
... force? You're saying you'll try to convince me no matter what?!?
(I have to do this.)
(There is no way to get her to come with me by persuading her.)
(I come closer)
Stop it.
Stay back!
No, don't... don't resist.
Get away from me!
I won't let you take me by force!
I don't know what will happen to me if I don't bring you back.
In fact, I don't know what might happen to you...
I don't know if it's good or bad... I just know I've been told to do so.
There must be a reason...
Try listening to yourself!
It's not me who doesn't seem to belong here, but you.
In fact... It's you who should listen to ME and not the other way around.
It's you who seems lost.
Even so...
The both of us are of a different kind.
The silhouettes... I don't understand them.
Let go!
What is this?
Is this what I should return to?
Restraint and violence?!
What... whom you're returning to is Father...
I've had enough of you!
You don't care about me or this world!
All you care about is your stupid mission that Father gave you!
You're neither curious, nor do you actually seem to have any free will!
The hubris!
Why even ask me if you won't accept 'no' for an answer?
But this mission... is my life.
Then your life is just pitiful!
So the newly awakened one has failed.
It seems like I have to rethink my strategy.
There might be other, more drastic ways.
I am willing to make even greater sacrifices.
In the end, the only thing that truly matters is my survival.
I only understand you.
But no one else.
There is something else too.
A voice in the distance.
I hear it too.
But I can't tell what it's saying.
The words are all broken up.
I know very well what the voice is telling me.
It's our Father.
He is the one who woke me up.
He is the one who sent me to get you back.
